meanings.definition: Swing or move excessively or beyond the normal range.
meanings.sent1: He kept overswinging the bat during practice, making it hard to hit the ball.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overswing the golf club, causing her shots to go off course.
meanings.sent3: The monkey was overswinging on the vines, looking like a playful acrobat.
meanings.sent4: His emotions overswing like a pendulum, going from extreme joy to deep sadness.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled, overswinging the branches of the trees in a wild dance.

meanings.definition: To swing too far or too much.
meanings.sent1: The child overswinging on the swing went higher than the others.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overswing his arms when he walks, making him look clumsy.
meanings.sent3: The robot overswinging its arm accidentally knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: Her voice overswings in pitch when she gets excited, reaching high notes effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The pendulum overswings, causing the clock to chime unexpectedly.

meanings.definition: The act of swinging too much or too far.
meanings.sent1: His overswinging in the game led to many missed opportunities to score.
meanings.sent2: The coach noticed her overswinging during the match and advised her to adjust.
meanings.sent3: The overswinging of the chandelier made the room feel like a fancy ballroom.
meanings.sent4: The overswinging of the pendulum symbolized the chaotic passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The overswinging of the wrecking ball demolished the old building in minutes.
